entry.title: Public Cloud - Copy inspection results from SFG to FG
entry.content:
Hi,

I want to copy inspection results from SFG inspection Lot (04 inspection type) to FG inspection lot (04 inspection type)

Result copy in configurations is active -

In Inspection Plan - Inspection char. > MIC > General Data > Results Data Origin is "02 Previous inspection lot"

When I select Copy inspection results in FG inspection lot, it should show me a pop-up to select the inspection lot, but following error occurs -

"300 - Custom selection of Inspection lot" is not available in Public cloud, so I have used "200 - Data from Insps for Preliminary Product"

Am I missing something?

entry.title: Replication in SAP S4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am trying to retrigger the replication for some interface [initializations ] in order to resend all the records using the “Replicate by Replication Model” option.

Since the number of records is very large, I selected the Background Mode checkbox to avoid a dump. However, nothing appears in the message dashboard after triggering it.

PS: I have already tried triggering it several times, and the communication arrangements are properly set up and active.

Could you please help me resolve this issue?

Kind regards

Safa

entry.title: Unable to Maintain tax rate with reference to HSN for Procurement (India Localization) in SAP S4H
entry.content:
I am trying to determine tax code in Purchase Order from the records we maintain in the app "Set Tax Rates - Purchasing". I have followed the steps as per the blog in SAP Community https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/maintain-tax-rate-with-reference-to-control-code-hsn-for-procurement-india/ba-p/13530242

I made all the configuration but its not working.

--- Steps to Reproduce ---

  1. Created Condition Table 533 with the below fields (SSCUI-102890)
Technical NameGlobal Field Name
LLANDDestinationCountry
REGIORegion
WKREGPlantRegion
VEN_CLASSIN_GSTSupplierClassification
TAXIMTaxIndicator
STEUCConsumptionTaxCtrlCode

2. Created Custom Access Sequence ZTX1 with table number 533 (SSCUI-102889)

3. Change the Access sequence in Condition type TTX1 (SSCUI-101094)

4. Create Condition record for TTX1 with App “Set Tax Rates – Purchasing” 

Global Field Name 
DestinationCountryIN
RegionGJ
PlantRegionTN
IN_GSTSupplierClassification 
TaxIndicator0
ConsumptionTaxCtrlCode85011011

5. Created Purchase Order

Tax Is not determined automatically in the tax code field.

If I am using SAP Standard Pricing Procedure (A18001) then the tax code determining from condition records for custom pricing procedure it is not working

entry.title: Unable to do partial down payment via scope item 7S7
entry.content:
Dear SAP Experts, 

In the business scenario in our customer, they would like to have the partial shipments and for those corresponding billing would need to be created with partial down payment settlement. Within scope item 7S7, we do have the advance down payment in the billing which created base on Delivery. However, we cannot change condition type DDPS to have the partial down payment settlement according to the percentage of the partial shipment.

entry.title: CBO Transported to TEST but Not Available in Business Catalog – SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We are working with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and using Key User Extensibility to create Custom Business Objects (CBOs).

The CBO is:

  • Created and published in DEV

  • Assigned to a business catalog in DEV

  • Successfully transported to the TEST system

However, in the TEST environment, the CBO is visible in the Custom Business Objects app, but cannot be found or assigned in any business catalog, even though the same catalog exists and was used in DEV.

My questions:

  • Is this behavior expected in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?

  • Are business catalog assignments for CBOs supposed to be re-done manually in each system?

  • Is there a specific sequence of steps that must be followed after transport to make the CBO available for catalog assignment?

Any clarification or best practices would be highly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your support.

entry.title: How to track stock by pack size (5/25/50kg) with one material number?
entry.content:
Hi all,

I have a case where one product (example: Cement) is physically stored and sold in different pack sizes: 5kg, 25kg, and 50kg bags.

Business want one material number only.

  • In reality, each pack size can have a different cost, so I handled that using split valuation (different valuation types per pack size).

  • But I’m wondering: if the cost is the same (so no need for split valuation), would it make sense to manage the different pack sizes using Handling Units (HU) in WMS ?

I tried HU management, but it looks like each individual bag becomes an HU, which feels unrealistic (you could end up with millions of HUs).

So my questions are:

  1. If cost is the same, what’s the best practice to represent the different pack sizes while still keeping one material?

  2. Is HU management meant for this scenario, or is it more for pallets/cartons only (and bags should be handled differently)?

Best regards,
Faisal

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud - Additional Ledgers - Automatic Creation
entry.content:
Hello all,

I hope all of you are doing great and will support and help on the following query:

I along with our team are reviewing the ledger architecture behavior in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, specifically regarding the automatic creation of additional ledgers (Extension / Commitment ledgers) upon scope item activation.

Based on our analysis and current system behavior, we understand that the following scope items trigger the creation of additional ledgers:

4GQ – Event-Based Revenue Recognition – Project-Based Sales → 2L (Extension Ledger)

1IL – Event-Based Revenue Recognition – Project-Based Services → 2L (Extension Ledger)

1K2 – Event-Based Revenue Recognition – Sell from Stock → 2L (Extension Ledger)

3M3 – Event-Based Revenue Recognition – Service Documents → 2L (Extension Ledger)

2FD – Predictive Accounting for Sales Orders → 2L (Extension Ledger)

4V7 – Predictive Accounting for Service Contract Management → 2L (Extension Ledger)

2I3 – Predictive Commitments Management → 0E (Commitment / Prediction Ledger)

3L3 – Contract Accounting – Contract-Based Revenue Recognition → 2L (Extension Ledger)

We kindly request your support and guidance on the following:

Are there any additional scope items, beyond those listed above, that result in the automatic creation of additional ledgers (e.g., 2L or 0E) in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud?

Can you confirm that all other scope items do not create additional ledgers and post exclusively to the leading ledger (0L)?

Is the creation of the management accounting ledger (0C) system-driven and not directly tied to the activation of individual scope items?

This clarification is important for all of us to ensure consistent scope activation decisions across projects and to avoid unintended ledger creation during tenant provisioning.

We appreciate all your support and guidance on this matter as I am sure it will help all the members too.
